<figure class="primary-video-wrapper" itemprop="video"><div class="video-wrapper"><iframe allowfullscreen="true" class="youtube-player" frameborder="0" height="390" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/WKU0qDpu3AM?version=3&amp;rel=1&amp;fs=1&amp;showsearch=0&amp;showinfo=1&amp;iv_load_policy=1&amp;wmode=transparent" type="text/html" width="640"></iframe></div></figure>
<h2 class="article-excerpt" itemprop="alternativeHeadline">One explainer video to rule them all</h2>
<span class="read-video-article collapsed">+ READ ARTICLE</span>
<div class="video-content"><p><em>The Lord of the Rings</em> was successful because J.R.R. Tolkien knew how to tell a good story, one that director Peter Jackson was able to bring to life on the screen. But Jackson’s version didn’t even scratch the surface of <em>The Lord of the Rings</em> mythology, a complex tale of wizards, elves and rings of power woven into a tapestry so tight it could be hung in the <span class="st">Great Hall of Thingol.</span></p>
<p>Luckily the elves that operate the internet, which may or may not be the same elves that populate Middle Earth, have heard our head scratching and created a helpful videos series that unravels some of the mysteries of the <em>Lord of the Rings</em>. In the latest installment of the informative series posted on <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2C_jShtL725hvbm1arSV9w" target="_blank">YouTube channel CGP Grey</a>, the origin story of the One Ring —and the secret to elven agelessness and dwarf wealth— is explained in less than five minutes.</p>
<p>If you are preparing to face-off against LOTR superfan <a href="http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/03/06/watch-stephen-colbert-schools-james-franco-in-lord-of-the-rings-trivia-smackdown/" target="_blank">Stephen Colbert</a> you may want to check out <a href="http://youtu.be/YxgsxaFWWHQ" target="_blank">p</a><a href="http://youtu.be/YxgsxaFWWHQ" target="_blank">art one of the series</a>, which helps you know your Balrogs from your Orcs.</p>
